TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class BluetoothDevice : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit BluetoothDevice extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a remote Bluetooth device.

remarks.para: Represents a remote Bluetooth device. A lets you create a connection with the respective device or query information about it, such as the name, address, class, and bonding state.

This class is really just a thin wrapper for a Bluetooth hardware address. Objects of this class are immutable. Operations on this class are performed on the remote Bluetooth hardware address, using the that was used to create this .

To get a , use to create one representing a device of a known MAC address (which you can get through device discovery with ) or get one from the set of bonded devices returned by . You can then open a for communication with the remote device, using .

Note: Requires the permission.
Developer Guides
For more information about using Bluetooth, read the Bluetooth developer guide.

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: Indicates a low level (ACL) connection has been established with a remote device.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: Indicates a low level (ACL) connection has been established with a remote device.
Always contains the extra field .
ACL connections are managed automatically by the Android Bluetooth stack.
Requires to receive.

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: Indicates a low level (ACL) disconnection from a remote device.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: Indicates a low level (ACL) disconnection from a remote device.
Always contains the extra field .
ACL connections are managed automatically by the Android Bluetooth stack.
Requires to receive.

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: Indicates that a low level (ACL) disconnection has been requested for a remote device, and it will soon be disconnected.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: Indicates that a low level (ACL) disconnection has been requested for a remote device, and it will soon be disconnected.

This is useful for graceful disconnection. Applications should use this intent as a hint to immediately terminate higher level connections (RFCOMM, L2CAP, or profile connections) to the remote device.
Always contains the extra field .
Requires to receive.

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: Indicates a change in the bond state of a remote device.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: Indicates a change in the bond state of a remote device. For example, if a device is bonded (paired).
Always contains the extra fields , and .
Requires to receive.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGatt ConnectGatt (Android.Content.Context context, bool autoConnect, Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback callback);

.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGatt ConnectGatt(class Android.Content.Context context, bool autoConnect, class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback callback) cil managed

Docs.param: Whether to directly connect to the remote device (false) or to automatically connect as soon as the remote device becomes available (true).
GATT callback handler that will receive asynchronous callbacks.
Docs.summary: Connect to GATT Server hosted by this device.

remarks.para: Connect to GATT Server hosted by this device. Caller acts as GATT client. The callback is used to deliver results to Caller, such as connection status as well as any further GATT client operations. The method returns a BluetoothGatt instance. You can use BluetoothGatt to conduct GATT client operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool CreateBond() cil managed

Docs.summary: Start the bonding (pairing) process with the remote device.

remarks.para: Start the bonding (pairing) process with the remote device.
This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. Register for intents to be notified when the bonding process completes, and its result.
Android system services will handle the necessary user interactions to confirm and complete the bonding process.
Requires .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothSocket CreateInsecureRfcommSocketToServiceRecord(class Java.Util.UUID uuid) cil managed

Docs.summary: Create an RFCOMM socket ready to start an insecure outgoing connection to this remote device using SDP lookup of uuid.

remarks.para: Create an RFCOMM socket ready to start an insecure outgoing connection to this remote device using SDP lookup of uuid.

The communication channel will not have an authenticated link key i.e it will be subject to man-in-the-middle attacks. For Bluetooth 2.1 devices, the link key will be encrypted, as encryption is mandatory. For legacy devices (pre Bluetooth 2.1 devices) the link key will be not be encrypted. Use if an encrypted and authenticated communication channel is desired.
This is designed to be used with for peer-peer Bluetooth applications.
Use to initiate the outgoing connection. This will also perform an SDP lookup of the given uuid to determine which channel to connect to.
The remote device will be authenticated and communication on this socket will be encrypted.

Hint: If you are connecting to a Bluetooth serial board then try using the well-known SPP UUID 00001101-0000-1000-8000-00805F9B34FB. However if you are connecting to an Android peer then please generate your own unique UUID.
Requires

Docs.exception: on error, for example Bluetooth not available, or insufficient permissions

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothSocket CreateRfcommSocketToServiceRecord(class Java.Util.UUID uuid) cil managed

Docs.param: service record uuid to lookup RFCOMM channel
Docs.summary: Create an RFCOMM ready to start a secure outgoing connection to this remote device using SDP lookup of uuid.

remarks.para: Create an RFCOMM ready to start a secure outgoing connection to this remote device using SDP lookup of uuid.
This is designed to be used with for peer-peer Bluetooth applications.
Use to initiate the outgoing connection. This will also perform an SDP lookup of the given uuid to determine which channel to connect to.
The remote device will be authenticated and communication on this socket will be encrypted.

Use this socket only if an authenticated socket link is possible. Authentication refers to the authentication of the link key to prevent man-in-the-middle type of attacks. For example, for Bluetooth 2.1 devices, if any of the devices does not have an input and output capability or just has the ability to display a numeric key, a secure socket connection is not possible. In such a case, use {#link createInsecureRfcommSocketToServiceRecord}. For more details, refer to the Security Model section 5.2 (vol 3) of Bluetooth Core Specification version 2.1 + EDR.

Hint: If you are connecting to a Bluetooth serial board then try using the well-known SPP UUID 00001101-0000-1000-8000-00805F9B34FB. However if you are connecting to an Android peer then please generate your own unique UUID.
Requires

Docs.exception: on error, for example Bluetooth not available, or insufficient permissions

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool FetchUuidsWithSdp() cil managed

Docs.summary: Perform a service discovery on the remote device to get the UUIDs supported.

remarks.para: Perform a service discovery on the remote device to get the UUIDs supported.

This API is asynchronous and intent is sent, with the UUIDs supported by the remote end. If there is an error in getting the SDP records or if the process takes a long time, intent is sent with the UUIDs that is currently present in the cache. Clients should use the to get UUIDs if service discovery is not to be performed.
Requires .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.OS.ParcelUuid[] GetUuids() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the supported features (UUIDs) of the remote device.

remarks.para: Returns the supported features (UUIDs) of the remote device.
This method does not start a service discovery procedure to retrieve the UUIDs from the remote device. Instead, the local cached copy of the service UUIDs are returned.
Use if fresh UUIDs are desired.
Requires .

Docs.summary: Get the friendly Bluetooth name of the remote device.

remarks.para: Get the friendly Bluetooth name of the remote device.
The local adapter will automatically retrieve remote names when performing a device scan, and will cache them. This method just returns the name for this device from the cache.
Requires

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
